H0.text: Atomic mass is the characteristic that neon (Ne), argon (Ar), and krypton (Kr) share in common, as they are all in the same column on the Periodic Table of the Elements.

H1.text: Negative electrical charge is the characteristic that Neon (Ne), argon (Ar), and krypton (Kr) share, as they occupy the same column on the Periodic Table of the Elements.

H2.text: The number of neutrons is the characteristic that neon (Ne), argon (Ar), and krypton (Kr) have in common as elements in the same column on the Periodic Table of the Elements.

H3.text: Full valence electron shells are the characteristic that neon, argon, and krypton share because they occupy the same column on the periodic table.

A4.text: The noble gases have full valence electron shells.
